title: Centre recommends legal action against ‘individual’ accused of murder plot by US - Hindustan Times
summary:
Centre recommends legal action against individual accused of murder plot by US

Date: Jan 15, 2025 Source: Hindustan Times

A high-powered enquiry panel submitted its report regarding activities that threatened the security interests of both India and the United States. The investigation was prompted by allegations of a murder plot against Khalistani terrorist Gurpatwant Singh Pannun.

  • The enquiry panel was established in November 2023 after the US raised concerns about an attempted murder.
  • Vikash Yadav, identified by the US, has been linked to the failed assassination attempt.
  • The enquiry committee conducted thorough investigations, receiving full cooperation from US authorities.
  • Legal action has been recommended against an individual involved in the plot based on criminal links discovered during the investigation.
  • The committee suggested improvements in systems to enhance India’s response to such matters.
“The Committee further recommended functional improvements in systems and procedures as also initiation of steps that could strengthen India’s response capability.”

This development highlights an essential collaboration between India and the US in addressing security threats, emphasizing the importance of coordinated efforts in combating terrorism.
newTitle: Centre recommends legal action against individual accused of murder plot by the US

High-powered Enquiry Committee submits report on activities of organised terror groups which undermined security interests of India, U.S. - The Hindu
summary:
High-powered Enquiry Committee submits report on activities of organised terror groups which undermined security interests of India, U.S.

Date: January 15, 2025 Source: The Hindu

A high-powered enquiry committee has submitted its findings regarding organised criminal groups and terrorist organisations that pose a threat to the security interests of both India and the U.S.

  • The investigation was prompted by allegations of a plot to assassinate Khalistani separatist Gurpatwant Singh Pannun by Indian agents.
  • The committee has recommended legal action against an individual discovered during the enquiry.
  • Cooperation from U.S. authorities was pivotal in the investigation.
  • The MHA established the committee in November 2023 following intelligence from U.S. sources.
  • The report suggests systemic improvements to enhance India's operational responses to threats.
"The Committee has further recommended functional improvements in systems and procedures as also initiation of steps that could strengthen India's response capability..."

The report addresses critical security concerns and proposes measures to bolster operational strategies in counter-terrorism efforts.
newTitle: High-powered Enquiry Committee Reports on Organised Terror Groups Threatening India-U.S. Security

title: LTTS Q3 Results: Net profit at ₹322 cr; targets 10% FY25 revenue growth in Constant Currency - CNBCTV18
summary:
LTTS Q3 Results: Net Profit at ₹322 Crore with 10% Revenue Growth Target

Publication Date: Jan 15, 2025 4:14 PM IST  | Source: CNBC TV18

L&T Technology Services Ltd. (LTTS) reported a net profit of ₹322.4 crore for Q3, below expectations, and is targeting 10% revenue growth in Constant Currency for FY25.

  • Net profit of ₹322.4 crore compared to ₹330 crore expected.
  • Revenue of ₹2,653 crore, a 9.5% year-on-year growth.
  • Dollar revenue reached $312 million, up 3.1% quarter-on-quarter.
  • EBIT for the quarter at ₹422 crore, surpassing expectations.
  • Largest ever large deal bookings with eight significant contracts.
“Our large deal TCV has seen a healthy increase with eight wins across segments.” - Amit Chadha, CEO and Managing Director.

The company's performance indicates a strong pipeline of large deals, although the current quarter's financial results were slightly below market expectations.
newTitle: LTTS Q3 Results: Net Profit at ₹322 Crore with 10% Revenue Growth Target

Biden bids farewell from Oval Office as Trump looms over his legacy - Reuters
summary:
Biden Bids Farewell from Oval Office as Trump Looms Over His Legacy

Publication Date: January 15, 2025

Source: Reuters

President Joe Biden is set to deliver his final Oval Office address as he reflects on his political career and the challenges he faced, particularly with Donald Trump poised to return to power.

  • Biden to make Oval Office address on Wednesday evening.
  • His decision to run for re-election has faced criticism from some Democrats.
  • Highlights his decades of experience in the Senate and as Vice President.
  • Leaves behind a strong economy with a focus on manufacturing recovery.
"I ran for president because I believed that the soul of America was at stake. The very nature of who we are was at stake. And, that’s still the case." - Joe Biden

In conclusion, Biden's presidency reflects significant achievements and enduring challenges as he navigates a political landscape reshaped by Trump's resurgence.

title: A man's brain is 10%-15% larger than a woman's: Understanding how it matters (at all) - The Times of India
summary:
A man's brain is 10%-15% larger than a woman's: Understanding how it matters (at all)

Publication Date: Not specified Source: Not specified

This article explores the differences in brain size between men and women, discussing whether these differences are significant and what they might mean.

  • Brain size is often cited to suggest differences in intelligence or capability.
  • The average male brain is reported to be 10%-15% larger than the female brain.
  • Experts argue that size does not equate to intelligence.
  • Cultural perceptions and myths about gender and intelligence are examined.
  • The article highlights the importance of context over mere anatomical differences.
"Brain size is only one aspect of a complex interaction of factors that contribute to intelligence."

In conclusion, while there may be measurable differences in brain size, the implications of these differences are often overstated in societal discussions.
newTitle: Understanding the Implications of Brain Size Differences Between Genders

title: Mahakumbh 2025 Live: 21-member foreign delegation to take holy dip in Triveni Sangam on Jan 16 - Hindustan Times
summary:
Mahakumbh 2025 Live: 21-member foreign delegation to take holy dip in Triveni Sangam on Jan 16

Publication Date: January 15, 2025 | Source: Hindustan Times

The Mahakumbh Mela 2025 is witnessing a significant influx of devotees, with the first 'Amrit Snan' occurring on Makar Sankranti. A delegation from 10 countries is set to join the holy dip at Triveni Sangam, highlighting the global interest in this cultural event.

  • The Mahakumbh Mela, held every 12 years, has seen over 35 million devotees participate in the rituals.
  • The 21-member foreign delegation includes representatives from countries like Fiji, Finland, and the UAE.
  • Uttar Pradesh Chief Minister Yogi Adityanath confirmed the attendance and shared updates on social media.
  • Significant economic benefits are expected, with estimates suggesting revenue of ₹2 lakh crore from the event.
“This is a celebration for all of Sanatan Dharma, a festival of immortality and eternal truth,” said Swami Chidanand Saraswati.

The Mahakumbh Mela is expected to continue attracting millions of attendees, creating a monumental gathering of faith and spirituality.
newTitle: Mahakumbh 2025 Live: 21-member foreign delegation to take holy dip in Triveni Sangam on Jan 16

title: Impeached President Yoon arrested in second attempt: What is behind the action-packed month in South Korea - The Indian Express
summary:
Impeached President Yoon Arrested in South Korea: A Month of Political Turmoil

Publication Date: January 15, 2025 | Source: Indian Express

South Korea’s impeached President Yoon Suk-yeol was arrested after weeks of escalating political drama, including protests and two impeachment motions.

  • Yoon faced criticism for his controversial domestic policies and his declaration of martial law on December 3, 2024.
  • A first impeachment motion on December 7 failed but a second was successful on December 14, leading to his temporary suspension.
  • Yoon was arrested on January 15, 2025, following clashes between his supporters and police.
  • The arrest followed investigations into treason and abuse of power, linked to martial law and attempts to provoke conflict with North Korea.
“Martial law was a desperate decision made by me, the president, as the final authority responsible for state affairs.” - Yoon Suk-yeol

This incident underscores South Korea's struggle with democracy and the memories of authoritarianism, as citizens demand accountability and transparency in governance.
newTitle: Impeached President Yoon Arrested in South Korea: A Month of Political Turmoil

title: PM Modi Commissions Three Made-In-India Frontline Naval Combatants In Major Defence Boost - News18
BMI alone not reliable measure of obesity, says Lancet report, seeks complete overhaul of diagnosis - CNBCTV18
summary:
BMI Alone Not Reliable Measure of Obesity, Says Lancet Report

Publication Date: Recent
Source: The Lancet Diabetes & Endocrinology

The body mass index (BMI) alone is not a reliable measure of obesity, according to a new report published in The Lancet. The report, endorsed by over 75 medical organizations, calls for a complete overhaul of the current obesity diagnosis criteria.

  • Obesity should be defined using multiple metrics, including waist circumference and health evidence, rather than BMI alone.
  • The current reliance on BMI can lead to misdiagnoses and potentially harmful consequences for individuals.
  • New categories such as 'clinical obesity' and 'pre-clinical obesity' have been proposed for more accurate diagnosis.
  • The report emphasizes the importance of country-specific definitions for obesity, reflecting differing risks associated with ethnicity.
  • Globally, over one billion people are estimated to live with obesity according to WHO.
“The whole goal of this is to get a more precise definition so that we are targeting the people who need the help most,” - Dr. David Cummings.

This new approach aims to refine the understanding and treatment of obesity, acknowledging its complexities and variations across different populations.
newTitle: BMI Alone Not Reliable Measure of Obesity, Says Lancet Report

title: NASA’s James Webb Space Telescope captures wood grain-like patterns revealing 3D structures of interstell - The Times of India
summary:
NASA’s James Webb Space Telescope captures wood grain-like patterns revealing 3D structures of interstellar dust

Publication Date: October 2023 Source: NASA

The James Webb Space Telescope has unveiled intricate wood grain-like patterns in interstellar spaces, providing significant insights into the structure of cosmic dust.

  • The telescope's advanced capabilities allowed for unprecedented clarity in observing interstellar dust.
  • These findings could reshape our understanding of cosmic formation and evolution.
  • Scientists are excited about the potential applications of this data in future astronomical research.
“This is a remarkable step forward in our studies of the universe,” a NASA spokesperson stated.

This new discovery emphasizes the importance of ongoing observations with the James Webb Space Telescope and the vast mysteries it still aims to uncover.
newTitle: NASA’s James Webb Space Telescope Reveals 3D Structures of Interstellar Dust

BJP takes ‘mental stability’ jibe at Rahul Gandhi over his ‘fighting Indian state’ remark - Hindustan Times
summary:
BJP takes ‘mental stability’ jibe at Rahul Gandhi over his ‘fighting Indian state’ remark

Published on: January 15, 2025, Source: Hindustan Times

In a recent speech, Congress MP Rahul Gandhi stated that the Congress party is not just opposing the BJP or RSS ideology, but is fighting the Indian state itself. This remark provoked a sharp response from several BJP leaders.

  • BJP leaders, including Union minister Hardeep Singh Puri and finance minister Nirmala Sitharaman, criticized Gandhi's comments.
  • Puri suggested that Gandhi should check his mental stability in light of his remarks.
  • Gandhi's speech included criticisms of RSS leader Mohan Bhagwat's statement about India’s independence celebration.
  • Nirmala Sitharaman questioned Gandhi's loyalty to the Constitution while making such claims.
“The people in power today don't salute the tricolour, don't believe in the national flag or the constitution...” - Rahul Gandhi

The controversy highlights the ongoing tensions between the Congress party and BJP in Indian politics, with Gandhi asserting that the Congress remains the only viable alternative to the BJP-led government.
newTitle: BJP Criticizes Rahul Gandhi's Remarks on 'Fighting Indian State'

title: Supreme Court Stays Declaration Of Result Of Bye-Election Held For Seat Of Bihar MLC Expelled Over... - Live Law - Indian Legal News
summary:
Supreme Court Stays Results of Bihar Legislative Council Bye-Election Amid Expulsion Controversy

Publication Date: Today, Source: Live Law

The Supreme Court has directed that the results of the Bihar Legislative Council Bye-Elections should not be declared following the expulsion of RJD MLC Sunil Kumar Singh over alleged defamatory remarks against Chief Minister Nitish Kumar.

  • The bye-election was called to fill the vacancy left by Sunil Kumar Singh's expulsion.
  • Justice Surya Kant noted that Singh's plea challenges the legality and fairness of his expulsion.
  • Singh's counsel argued that the charges leading to his client's expulsion lacked consistency and due process.
  • The Supreme Court will hear further arguments tomorrow regarding the case.
“If statements lead to permanent expulsion merely because objectionable as per the majority, it would end democracy.” - Dr. Abhishek Manu Singhvi

This case underscores the tension between legislative conduct and the principles of democratic discourse as the court deliberates on the merits of Singh’s case.
newTitle: Supreme Court Stays Results of Bihar Legislative Council Bye-Election Amid Expulsion Controversy

Meta India apologises for CEO Mark Zuckerberg’s remark on 2024 elections, terms it “inadvertent error” - The Hindu
summary:
Meta India Apologizes for Zuckerberg's Comments on 2024 Elections

Date: January 15, 2025

Source: The Hindu

Meta India has issued an apology following CEO Mark Zuckerberg's erroneous comments regarding the 2024 elections in India, which he made during a podcast, indicating the ruling government lost power.

  • Meta's vice president, Shivnath Thukral, stated the comments were an "inadvertent error".
  • Several political figures, including BJP leader Nishikant Dubey, accepted the apology, emphasizing the strong support for Prime Minister Narendra Modi.
  • Union Minister Ashwini Vaishnaw criticized Zuckerberg's claims as misinformation.
  • India's 2024 elections saw over 640 million voters reaffirm their trust in the current government.
“A Meta India official has finally apologised for the mistake. This is a victory of the common citizens of India.” - Nishikant Dubey

The apology marks the conclusion of a political controversy, with officials expressing the importance of maintaining accurate information from prominent organizations like Meta.
newTitle: Meta India Apologizes for Zuckerberg's Comments on 2024 Elections

title: Novak Djokovic on the challenge of playing an up-and-coming opponent | ATP Tour | Tennis - ATP Tour
summary:
Novak Djokovic on the challenge of playing an up-and-coming opponent

Publication Date: January 15, 2025

Source: ATP Tour

Novak Djokovic reflects on the challenges he faces when competing against younger opponents at the Australian Open, emphasizing the unpredictability and pressure these matches present.

  • Djokovic defeated Jaime Faria 6-1, 6-7(4), 6-3, 6-2 to reach the third round.
  • He compared his experience to Faria and another young player he faced, highlighting their aggressive play.
  • Djokovic discussed the pressure of playing against opponents who have 'nothing to lose' on the big stage.
  • This victory marked Djokovic's 430th match in Grand Slam main draws, setting a new all-time record.
  • He praised rising star Joao Fonseca, mentioning Brazil's importance in the tennis scene.
“Brazil is a huge country. Super important for our sport to have a very good player coming from Brazil.” - Novak Djokovic

Djokovic's insights highlight the excitement and unpredictability of tennis as new talents emerge, indicating a promising future for the sport.
newTitle: Novak Djokovic Discusses Challenges of Facing Rising Tennis Stars

title: Pant available for Delhi's next Ranji Trophy game, but DDCA 'haven't heard from Kohli' - ESPNcricinfo
Pratika Rawal 154, Smriti Mandhana 135, India 435/5 as records tumble like pack of cards against Ireland - Hindustan Times
summary:
India registered their highest total (435/5) in ODIs, riding on centuries from Pratika Rawal (154) and Smriti Mandhana (135) against Ireland.

Date & Source: Jan 15, 2025, Hindustan Times

India registered their highest total in Women's ODIs, achieving 435/5 in the last ODI match against Ireland, following a previous record of 370/3. This match marked significant records for both Pratika Rawal and Smriti Mandhana.

  • Pratika Rawal scored 154, while Smriti Mandhana scored 135, both contributing significantly to India’s total.
  • Mandhana reached the fastest century by an Indian woman in just 70 balls.
  • This total is India's highest in ODIs, and it ranks fourth in the history of Women's ODIs.
  • India became the third team to surpass the 400-run mark in Women's ODIs.
“Mandhana's blistering knock, her fifth century in this format since the start of 2024, came to an end when she tried to play the lap shot off Orla Prendergast and was caught at fine leg.”

The performance of these players not only sets a new benchmark for India but also enhances their stature in women's cricket internationally.
newTitle: India Sets Record with Highest Women's ODI Total Against Ireland

title: ‘Inadvertent error': Meta India apologises for Mark Zuckerberg's remark on 2024 elections - Hindustan Times
summary:
Meta India Apologizes for Zuckerberg's Remarks on 2024 Elections

Publication Date: January 15, 2025
Source: Hindustan Times

Meta India has issued an apology for comments made by CEO Mark Zuckerberg regarding the 2024 elections in India, clarifying that the remark about the incumbent government losing due to its COVID-19 handling was an 'inadvertent error'.

  • Mark Zuckerberg claimed that many incumbent governments lost elections worldwide, including India.
  • Meta India's vice president, Shivnath Thukral, emphasized India’s importance and issued the apology via a post on X.
  • BJP MP Nishikant Dubey criticized the misinformation and stated that Meta would be summoned by his committee.
  • Union minister Ashwini Vaishnaw countered Zuckerberg's statement, highlighting India's successful 2024 elections with over 640 million voters.
“The people of India reaffirmed their trust in the NDA led by PM Narendra Modi's leadership.” — Ashwini Vaishnaw

This incident underscores the sensitivity surrounding misinformation and the significance of accurate statements by international figures regarding local democratic processes.
newTitle: Meta India Apologizes for Zuckerberg's Remarks on 2024 Elections

Star cricketer Virat Kohli recently returned to Mumbai from his holiday home in Alibaug, showcasing a lavish property complete with luxury amenities.

  • Amidst his recent poor performance in cricket, there is speculation about Kohli and Anushka relocating to London in the future.
  • Kohli is included in the probables list for the last two fixtures of the Ranji Trophy, although his participation is doubtful.

title: ShareChat to lay off 5% of its workforce; fourth round of job cuts in 2 years - Moneycontrol
summary:
ShareChat to Lay Off 5% of Workforce in Fourth Round of Job Cuts

Date: January 15, 2025
Source: Moneycontrol

ShareChat, a Google- and Temasek-backed social media unicorn, is set to lay off about five percent of its workforce, equivalent to 20-30 employees, following its annual performance review.

  • The company currently employs between 530-550 workers.
  • ShareChat has previously laid off upwards of 850 employees over the last two years.
  • The layoffs are part of a routine appraisal cycle which has consistently led to a small percentage of employees being let go based on performance ratings.
  • After the layoffs, ShareChat's headcount will be significantly reduced from its peak of around 2,800 employees.
“We have just kickstarted our annual appraisal cycle. Every performance cycle, as a practice, roughly 3-4 percent of employees are rated at the bottom of the pyramid in terms of performance.” - ShareChat spokesperson

This ongoing trend indicates ShareChat's continued focus on cost-effectiveness and restructuring amidst changing market conditions.
newTitle: ShareChat to Lay Off 5% of Workforce in Fourth Round of Job Cuts
